"India's enormous depth in pace bowling is the envy of most countries...Team India has evolved...[to a team] that is extremely difficult to beat under any conditions," he added.

354.title: 2 Palestinians who killed 3 civilians using axes arrested: Israel
354.article_body: Israeli security forces on Sunday said that the two Palestinians who killed three civilians in the Elad city have been arrested. The attackers had allegedly used axes to hack the victims on the country's Independence Day. They were caught by the forces in a forest near Elad. The duo appeared to be unhurt in pictures that surfaced following their arrest.

355.title: Tata Projects shortlisted for Noida airport construction
355.article_body: Tata Projects has been shortlisted to construct the terminal, runway and various other airside and landside facilities at the Noida International Airport in Jewar. As per reports, Tata Projects scored higher than other bidders, Larsen & Toubro and Shapoorji Pallonji Group, under the quality and cost-based selection criteria. It might reportedly get the contract after two-three weeks.

356.title: 19 policemen hurt, 12 vehicles damaged in mob attack at Maha steel factory; 27 held
356.article_body: Nineteen policemen sustained injuries and 12 of their vehicles were damaged when they tried to control an attack on a steel factory's employees by over 100 members of a labour union in Maharashtra's Palghar. So far 27 people have been arrested over the incident that took place on Saturday. The situation is tense, but under control, a police spokesperson said.

357.title: When I was expecting, people said 'This will end your career': Malaika
357.article_body: Malaika Arora, speaking to Humans of Bombay, recalled her pregnancy and revealed that when she was expecting Arhaan, people said her career would come to an end. "Back then, after marriage, you'd barely see an actress on screen," she said, adding, "Two months after delivery...I performed at an award show...In fact, I said yes...for 'Kaal Dhamaal' a year after delivery!"

358.title: Thank you for all the love: Sanjay as his debut film Rocky completes 41 yrs
358.article_body: Sanjay Dutt took to Instagram to share a photo from his debut film, 'Rocky', and celebrated 41 years of being in Bollywood. Alongside the post, he wrote, "Four decades + one year is sure a lifetime of a journey! Thank you for all the love you all gave me as 'Rocky'...I hope to keep entertaining all my fans and well-wishers."

359.title: Facebook to drop Nearby Friends, other location-based features
359.article_body: Facebook has started notifying its users that its Nearby Friends, weather alerts, location history and other location-based features won't be available after May 31, 9to5Mac reported. All user information related to these features will reportedly be deleted from Facebook's servers. Users can download their background location data and location history till August 1, the report added.

360.title: Devotees’ footfall is more than capacity in Char Dham Yatra: U’khand CM
360.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Sunday said that devotees’ footfall in Char Dham Yatra, which is resuming after two years, is more than expected. "We are making all possible arrangements but people are more than the capacity at all the four dhams," Dhami added. "We request devotees to make lodging and other arrangements prior to their arrival," Dhami stated.

361.title: Johnny Depp gets gifts, cards from fans outside court amid trial
361.article_body: A video going viral on social media shows actor Johnny Depp being showered with gifts, cards and bouquets by fans as he waves to them while exiting the court in his car amid his ongoing defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard. The video also shows Amber's car exiting the court in silence until a fan of Johnny says, "Lying narcissist."

362.title: Putin busy with Ukraine, Finland & Sweden can join now: NATO ex-chief
362.article_body: Former NATO chief Anders Fogh Rasmussen has said that Finland and Sweden can join the group "exactly now as Russian President Vladimir Putin is preoccupied in Ukraine". "He [Putin] can't do anything about it," he added. He further said that the two countries would be exposed to Russian intimidation and threats if they don't become NATO members now.

363.title: Mumbai-based electronics firm loses ₹7 lakh in cyber fraud
363.article_body: A Mumbai-based electronics firm was duped of ₹7 lakh through email spoofing, according to a police complaint. In an email sent by the accused, an accountant of the company was asked to pay the amount to a Gujarat-based supplier. The fraud was discovered after the supplier informed the firm that no payment has been received.

364.title: Kajal edits Mother's Day post after writer accuses her of copying her poem
364.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal edited her Mother's Day post on Instagram after she was called out by a writer for copying her poem. Kajal has now given credits to the writer and turned off the comments on the post. The writer had claimed that Kajal's post featured an original poem by her and even the caption was copied from her.

365.title: First Made-In-India semi high-speed train set handed over to NCRTC
365.article_body: The first Made-In-India semi high-speed train set for the Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) was handed over to the National Capital Region Transport Corporation (NCRTC) on Saturday, Alstom tweeted. The train has been designed and developed in India by Alstom's local arm. The train is expected to reduce travel time between Delhi and Meerut by 40%, a press release noted.

366.title: Dreaming of becoming Jinnah: BJP on Owaisi's Gyanvapi mosque remark
366.article_body: BJP MP Harnath Singh Yadav on Sunday criticised AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and demanded his arrest for his remarks on the Gyanvapi mosque survey, adding that he's dreaming of becoming Jinnah. Yadav said that Owaisi wants to create a rift between Hindus and Muslims in the country, for which a case of sedition should be registered against him.

367.title: 3 dead, several injured as bus falls into gorge in Maharashtra's Raigad
367.article_body: At least three persons died and several others sustained injuries after a bus carrying 35 passengers fell into a gorge in Maharashtra's Raigad district on Sunday. According to preliminary information, the accident took place after the bus plunged around 50-60 feet into the gorge. The passengers were travelling from Thane to attend a function at Shrivardhan village, as per reports.

368.title: 20-yr-old woman found hanging in train's washroom in Maharashtra
368.article_body: A 20-year-old woman was found hanging in the washroom of an express train at a station in Maharashtra on Sunday. A man and a child who accompanied the woman have been absconding. The incident took place on the Swaraj Express train, which runs from Bandra Terminus in Mumbai to Jammu and Kashmir's Katra.

369.title: 5 people arrested in gaming racket in Hyderabad; cash seized
369.article_body: Hyderabad's Madgul Police along with a special operations team (SOT) under Rachakonda Commissionerate busted a gaming racket on Saturday. Reacting to a tip-off, police raided a gaming area in Bramhan pally and arrested five persons in connection with the crime. Police also seized ₹22,065 and two mobile phones from the accused.

370.title: 3 men held for beating gurudwara manager to death in Punjab
370.article_body: Three men were arrested for beating to death Gurudwara Shri Nabha Sahib's manager in Zirakpur on shrine's premises over an argument. According to the complaint, one of the accused had been living in a room on the gurudwara premises. He also opened an office in it along with another accused, following which the manager asked them to vacate the room.

371.title: 19-year-old Carlos 1st player to beat Nadal, Djokovic in same clay court event
371.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz has become the first player ever to beat both Novak Djokovic and Rafael Nadal in the same clay court tournament. Alcaraz defeated world number one Novak Djokovic 6-7 (5-7), 7-5, 7-6 (7-5) to reach the Madrid Open final. He had earlier defeated Nadal 6-2, 1-6, 6-3 in the quarter-final of the tournament.

372.title: Joe Root will bat at number 4 in Test matches: Ben Stokes
372.article_body: England's newly-appointed Test captain Ben Stokes has said that former skipper Joe Root will bat at number four in England's Test matches. "I've already spoken with Joe. I've asked him to go back to four and I'm going to be at six," Stokes said. "Joe will probably be averaging 90 now instead of 60 so it'll be good," Stokes added.

373.title: Bhubaneswar to host Indian Grand Prix 3 and 4 this month
373.article_body: Bhubaneswar will be hosting the Indian Grand Prix 3 and 4 on May 21 and 24 respectively. The events will be hosted by the Odisha government in collaboration with the Athletics Federation of India and the Odisha Athletics Association. A total of 17 events will be held in the two competitions. Notably, Madurai was previously the designated venue.

374.title: 19-yr-old dies by suicide after being raped by her father in UP
374.article_body: UP's Banda Police on Saturday arrested a 49-year-old labourer for allegedly sexually assaulting his 19-year-old daughter, after which she allegedly died by suicide. The woman's younger sister told the police that their father on Wednesday evening came home in a drunken state and allegedly raped her elder sister, adding that she was depressed and took the extreme step on Thursday.

375.title: Nora gifts dancing gears to underprivileged contestants on her dance show
375.article_body: Actress Nora Fatehi gifted dancing gears to a group of aspiring underprivileged dancers on a dance-based reality show. It included athleisure wear, and shoes, in addition, she also created a fund to support their education. The female dancers hailed from a small town in Madhya Pradesh. While interacting with the girls, Nora learnt about the background of these dancers.

376.title: Aaditya Thackeray to visit Ayodhya on non-political visit on June 10: Raut
376.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray will visit Ayodhya in Uttar Pradesh on June 10 along with Shiv Sena workers from across the country and will seek blessings there, party leader Sanjay Raut said. "Preparations for welcoming Shiv Sena have started in Ayodhya," Raut added. "It's not at all political," Raut stated.

377.title: Delhi Police's complicity in Jahangirpuri violence must be probed: Court
377.article_body: A Delhi court said there was an "utter failure" on the part of the Delhi Police in stopping a Hanuman Jayanti procession held without permission at Jahangirpuri last month. Police personnel "accompanied the illegal procession" and their complicity, "if any", needs to be investigated, the court said in an order. Issue "seems to have been simply brushed aside", it added.

378.title: Deepika said same thing about 'Jayeshbhai...' trailer & '83': Ranveer
378.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has revealed wife Deepika Padukone is "brutally honest" and "always tells it like it is". He added that she said the same thing after watching '83' and 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' trailer. "She was like, 'What you're doing is quite unprecedented, because you are bonafide mainstream, yet you are able to, time after time, create distinctive characters'," Ranveer said.

379.title: I feel your love every day: Janhvi remembers Sridevi on Mother's Day
379.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor took to Instagram on Sunday to share a post remembering her late mother and actress Sridevi on the occasion of Mother's Day. Sharing an old picture of herself with Sridevi, Janhvi wrote, "Even in your absence, I feel your love every day. Even in your absence, you're the best mother in the world. Love you."

380.title: Odisha woman and son lose money after betting on IPL matches, die by suicide
380.article_body: A 55-year-old woman and her 22-year-old son died by suicide in Odisha after losing money by betting on IPL matches. Police said the woman had borrowed money to get her daughter married four years ago and was under pressure from lenders to repay the money. The deceased's neighbours told police that the woman hadn't had a meal for three days.

381.title: He wanted to say so much, couldn't express: Neetu on Rishi's last interaction
381.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor has revealed that when her husband late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor was on the ventilator, there was no communication. She added that she took an iPad with alphabet and told him to point out what he wanted to say but he couldn't lift his finger. "He wanted to say so much and he couldn't express," Neetu said.

382.title: Big belly was the first thing that came to my mind: Pranitha on pregnancy
382.article_body: Actress Pranitha Subhash, who's expecting her first child with husband Nithin Raju, has said the first thing that came to her mind after the positive pregnancy test was a big belly. "As actors, we're obsessed with our looks...But when you get pregnant, you slowly start to think...there's another human being (growing inside you)...That fact takes over your life," she added.

383.title: 64 school students test +ve for COVID-19 at 2 hostels in Odisha
383.article_body: As many as 64 students from different schools have tested COVID-19 positive at two hostels in Odisha's Rayagada. Following this, the health department has called for the 100% health screening of all boarders in residential schools and the preparation of a school-wise action plan. Odisha reported 71 new cases on Saturday, the highest in about a month and a half.

384.title: We have a lovely bond: Avesh on relationship between LSG's pace unit
384.article_body: LSG pacer Avesh Khan, speaking about the relationship between the team's fast-bowling unit, said, "We four have a lovely bond." LSG's pace unit consists of Avesh, Dushmantha Chameera, Mohsin Khan and Jason Holder. Avesh, who scalped three wickets versus KKR on Saturday, stated Mohsin and Chameera gave LSG a good start in the match which helped reduce pressure on him.

385.title: Who was Anna Jarvis, the founder of Mother's Day?
385.article_body: Anna Jarvis was an American activist who founded Mother's Day in 1908 to honour her mother Ann Reeves Jarvis and all mothers. Ann Reeves spent her life working for causes centred around motherhood including the prevention of child mortality and had a desire for the establishment of such a holiday. Anna managed to fulfil her mother's wish after her death.

386.title: Kohli gets out on 1st ball of the match, records his 3rd golden duck of IPL 2022
386.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli got out for a golden duck on the first delivery of their match against SRH on Sunday. Kohli was caught by Kane Williamson at short midwicket on the bowling of spinner Jagadeesha Suchith. This is the third time that Kohli has been dismissed for a golden duck in IPL 2022.

387.title: RBI rate hike wasn't surprising, its timing was: FM Sitharaman
387.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the recent interest rate hike by the RBI was not surprising for her but its timing was. "It came as a surprise because it came between two monetary policy reviews," she added. For the first time since August 2018, RBI on May 4 raised its key lending rate by 40 basis points to 4.40%.

388.title: KKR's Venkatesh is working hard to come back stronger into squad: McCullum
388.article_body: Talking about Venkatesh Iyer, who was dropped from KKR's last two matches in IPL 2022, head coach Brendon McCullum said the all-rounder is working hard in the nets to make a strong comeback into the squad for the remaining matches. "He's a real talent," he added. Venkatesh has scored 132 runs and has been wicketless from nine matches so far.

389.title: Amount of cricket that is expected of people to play is ridiculous: Stokes
389.article_body: England's newly-appointed Test captain Ben Stokes has said the cricketing schedule needs to be looked at. "It really needs looking at from a workload point of view...I want to play as much as I can for England...but...[it's] not possible," he added. Stokes cited the clash of their three-Test series against NZ and the ODI series against the Netherlands as example.

390.title: List of states with most & least domestic violence against women released
390.article_body: As per the National Family Health Survey-5 report, 29% women (of 18-49 age group) in India faced domestic violence. Accordingly, 44.4% women reported domestic violence in Karnataka, 40% in Bihar, 39.6% in Manipur, 38% in Tamil Nadu and 36.9% in Telangana. Lakshadweep (1.3%), Goa (8.3%), Kerala (9.9%), Sikkim (12%) and Meghalaya (16%) reported the least domestic violence against women.

391.title: If cheap fuel is available, why won't we buy it?: FM on India buying Russian oil
391.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that it made "perfect sense" for India to buy Russian oil if it's being offered at a discounted rate, especially amid inflation. She added, "I think we'll go ahead with what is good for the country. We need cheaper fuel. If it is available, why won't we want to buy it? We will buy it."

392.title: FIR against 2 Mumbai mosques for using loudspeakers for azaan before 6 am
392.article_body: Police have registered cases against functionaries of two mosques in Mumbai for using loudspeakers for the early morning prayers before 6 am. A police constable from Bandra police station complained he had heard the azaan being sounded through a loudspeaker at 5.15 am on Thursday. Another sub-inspector heard the azaan being sounded through a loudspeaker at 5.35 am in Santacruz.

393.title: Raj Police reach news anchor Aman Chopra's UP house to arrest him, find it locked
393.article_body: A team of Rajasthan Police went to UP's Noida to arrest news anchor Aman Chopra over his show on the demolition of a temple in Alwar. The arrest wasn't made as Chopra's house was found locked, Rajasthan Police said, adding that UP Police 'didn't cooperate' with them. Chopra's arrest was stayed by Rajasthan HC in two out of three FIRs.

394.title: Malayalam Mission's Qatar official fired over remark against nurses
394.article_body: Malayalam Mission, an initiative by Kerala government to promote the language, fired its Qatar regional coordinator, Durgadas Sisupalan, over derogatory remarks against nurses. "Under the guise of recruiting nurses…we have come to know that they are being taken [to Gulf countries] for meeting the sexual needs of terrorists," Sisupalan reportedly said at Ananthapuram Hindu Maha Sammelan in Kerala.

395.title: RCB to bat first against SRH, SRH make 2 changes to their playing XI
395.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis won the toss and elected to bat first against SRH in their IPL 2022 clash on Sunday. RCB are fielding an unchanged side, while SRH have made two changes to their playing XI. Sean Abbott and Shreyas Gopal have been replaced by Fazalhaq Farooqi and Jagadeesha Suchith in SRH's playing XI.

396.title: Minority body seeks report over Bagga 'not being allowed to wear turban' during arrest
396.article_body: After BJP's Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga alleged he wasn't allowed to wear a turban when Punjab Police came to arrest him in Delhi, National Commission for Minorities Chairman Iqbal Singh Lalpura has written to Punjab's chief secretary seeking a report "within seven days". Further, the Punjab unit of the BJP alleged that Bagga's father was thrashed during the arrest.

397.title: Anand Mahindra gifts a house to TN's 'Idli Amma' on Mother's Day; shares video
397.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra gifted a house to Tamil Nadu's M Kamalathal on the occasion of Mother's Day. Kamalathal, who is fondly known as 'Idli Amma', has been cooking and selling idlis for ₹1 for the past 30 years. "She's the embodiment of a Mother's virtues...A privilege to be able to support her and her work," Mahindra tweeted, sharing her video.

398.title: Two-day training camp for Haj volunteers being held in Mumbai
398.article_body: The Union Minister of Minority Affairs, Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi, on Saturday inaugurated a two-day training camp for Khadim-ul-Hujjaj (haj volunteers) at the Haj House in Mumbai. Over 400 people, including 12 women, will undergo training at the camp. In a tweet, Naqvi said that 79,237 Indians will go for Haj this year, half of them women.

399.title: Top Infibeam executive R Srikanth, wife murdered by driver in Chennai after US return
399.article_body: R Srikanth, the head of corporate finance at finance company Infibeam, and his wife Anuradha were murdered by their driver Krishna in Mylapore in Chennai on Saturday. Srikanth and Anuradha had just returned to India after visiting their daughter in US. Krishna was arrested from Andhra Pradesh while attempting to escape to Nepal with some looted items in a car.

400.title: Arshdeep has been brilliant: Punjab Kings skipper Mayank Agarwal
400.article_body: Punjab Kings skipper Mayank Agarwal has said that pacer Arshdeep Singh has "been nothing short of brilliant" for their franchise in this year's IPL. "He (Arshdeep) puts his hand up when the team needs it. He has been a leader...and it has been fantastic for us. We have to make the best use of our resources," Agarwal said.

401.title: Dating apps being used by sex offenders to lure people: Hyd Police
401.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police warned on Sunday that sex offenders are using dating applications and social media platforms to lure people into prostitution and human trafficking. Most victims of sex trafficking are from Bangladesh, who are offered fake job offers in metropolitan cities, officials said. Police also shared a helpline number for citizens to report any illegal activities.

402.title: Knew hard length would work against Russell: LSG pacer Avesh Khan
402.article_body: After winning against KKR by 75 runs, LSG pacer Avesh Khan has said that he knew that the "hard length ball" would work against KKR all-rounder Andre Russell. "The attempt was to get Russell out...My aim was to go with the hard lengths even if that goes for six. His wicket was the best of the three," Khan said.
